text: Leon Jackson (born 30 December 1988) is a Scottish singer. He won the 2007 UK series of the television show The X Factor. His singles are "When You Believe", "Don't Call This Love" and "Creative". His album is Right Now. ==Early life== Leon Jackson was born in Whitburn, West Lothian, Scotland on 30 December 1998. He previously worked as retail sales assistant with Gap. He supports Rangers FC. At the age of 10 he got his black belt. Before X Factor, he was planning to attend Edinburgh Napier University to study architectural technology. ==Career== ===2007: The X Factor=== In 2007, Leon Jackson auditioned for the fourth series of The X Factor in Glasgow, he went on to win the competition, after winning Jackson got a £1 million contract with Simon Cowell's company Syco. His winners single "When You Believe", a cover of a song sung by Whitney Houston and Mariah Carey, reached number one on the UK Singles Chart. ===2008–2009: Right Now=== He released his second single "Don't Call This Love" in October 2008 and reached number three on the UK Singles Chart. His debut album Right Now was released on 20 October 2008 and peaked at number four on the UK Albums Chart. His third single "Creative" peaked at number 94 and his fourth single "Stargazing" failed to chart, in March 2009 he was dropped by his record label after his album sold 130,000 copies. ==Discography== ===Studio albums=== List of albums, with selected chart positions and certifications Title Album details Peak chart positions Sales Certifications SCO Peak positions on the Scottish Charts: * For "When You Believe": * For "Don't Call This Love": * For Right Now: UK IRE Right Now * Released: 20 October 2008 * Label: Syco, Sony Music * Formats: CD, digital download 2 4 7 * UK: 136,117 * UK: GoldCertified Awards * IRE: Platinum ===Singles=== Year Title Peak chart positions Certifications Album SCO UK IRE 2007 "When You Believe" 1 1 1 * UK: Gold Right Now 2008 "Don't Call This Love" 1 3 8 "Creative" — 94 — 2009 "Stargazing" — — — "—" denotes a single that did not chart or was not released. ==References== Category:1988 births Category:Living people Category:British pop musicians Category:British jazz musicians Category:Scottish rock musicians Category:Scottish singers Category:The X Factor winners Category:People from West Lothian
